Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in dismissing the refugee claim by ignoring evidence linking persecution to political affiliation
Outcome: Board's decision set aside, matter remitted for redetermination
Evidence_Type: Evidence of targeting due to PPP merchandise sales
Legal_Provision: Section 96 and 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Nexus between persecution and Convention grounds
Application_Error: Selective treatment of evidence, failure to consider nexus to political opinion
Evidence_Ignored: Evidence linking sale of PPP merchandise to political affiliation and targeted persecution
Legal_Standard: Well-founded fear of persecution on Convention grounds
Application_Factor: Personal risk not generally faced by population
Decision_Outcome: Claim dismissed initially, then remitted for new hearing
Decision_Review_Issue: Error of law in assessing nexus to Convention grounds
Outcome_of_Review: Decision set aside, remitted for redetermination
Cause_of_Refusal: Perceived lack of nexus to Convention grounds
Procedural_Fairness: Failure to properly assess evidence may raise procedural fairness concerns
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge based on legal error in interpretation of Convention grounds
